ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 279
ygData.msgSnippet: Failure is always a possibility, no way to avoid that.  I would pay the money for the bar first to minimize your losses.  If it succeeds then pay the fee for
ygData.messageBody:
Failure is always a possibility, no way to avoid that. I would pay the
money for the bar first to minimize your losses. If it succeeds then pay
the fee for the work. Since Jewelers are by nature merchants that live and
die by their reputation I don't think the 'sucker' scenario is very likely.
Do a /who and make sure they're a 24th level enchanter for gold jewelry.
(it's something in the thirties for platinum) Lying about the failure I
don't have a suggestion for other then word of mouth recommendation for an
honest jeweler.

Bujold (trappd in 19th level hell)
Xegony

______________________________ Reply Separator _________________________________
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Digest Number 279
Author: Non-HP-WebberJ (WebberJ@...) at HP-ColSprings,mimegw5
Date: 8/20/99 11:43 AM


From: "Webber, Jessica" <WebberJ@...>

> If you ever get a black pearl or a diamond as loot DON'T
> sell them!
>
> Save them till you find a good jeweler and commission
> him/her to make
> jewelry for you. Those two gems are tops as far as I
> can tell and are
> only available as loot. Most gems can be bought from
> vendors but not
> the very best ones. Black pearls add to both str and
> dex and diamonds
> add to 4 different things!

So, assuming I ever find myself fingering a black pearl in my pocket &
negotiating a price with some jeweler, any recommendations for how to cover
myself in case a) the jeweler fails, or b) the jeweler claims they failed,
or c) the jeweler laughs, says "Sucker!" and starts to run away? This is
assuming I'm not on a PvP server and can't kill him or her.

Evulia of Tunare
Kingbird of Brell Serillis
